overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to short-term time-series forecasting using limited historical records. The analyst identifies daily seasonality, acknowledges data limitations, and selects a simple averaging method as a robust solution. The approach prioritizes interpretability and computational simplicity while maintaining reasonable accuracy for the given constraints.
common_data_patterns: Higher nighttime values and lower daytime values
Absence of missing values in provided data
key_insights: Short data history (4 days) necessitates simpler models over complex statistical methods
Daily patterns can be effectively captured through hourly averaging when weekly seasonality is unattainable
Data granularity (hourly) directly informs seasonality period selection
Practical implementation requires rounding consistency and date sequence generation
Heuristic methods provide viable baselines when model selection is constrained
complexity_analysis: Moderately simple with clear step-by-step logic, focusing on data observation and practical implementation rather than advanced statistical modeling. Balances pattern recognition with computational feasibility.
